channel.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
channel.description:
Ok. I play halo reach and for those of you who play halo, if your internet sucks ass it goes to the black screen every now and then and laggs randomly. The things I have done to fix this is: Switch to my other Xbox (Didn't work) Buy the new Datel Xbox 'N' Wireless Networking Adaptor that is rated 4/5 stars (Think its good, don't think its the cause) My dad bought a new Linksys E4200 Router (hasent helped yet) Installed Halo to my hard drive (didn't work) Rebooted my internet multiple times (hasen't worked)
My network status says the Upstrean Bandwitch: Warning!, My NAT is open and my Packet Loss Rate is: Low/Excellent.
I would post on the Bungie forums and Xbox forums but you usually do not get a tech support response so any help?

item.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I have 60 MB/S of upload so i don’t think its my internet. It has to be some setting in my router configuration.

Read full topic
item.source: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox

item.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

if your internet sucks ass

Maybe get better internet?

Read full topic
item.source: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox

item.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:5, topic:426085”]I experienced repeated lag with Call of Duty and the most common answer I found (I am Linksys router as well) was to go into the router settings and change the channel. I haven’t had lag since (except the occasional crap host).
http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/21132/change-your-wi-fi-router-channel-to-optimize-your-wireless-signal/[/quote]Thanks for the advice, I tried it and it still does the same thing. I am thinking its just my internet I have.

Read full topic
item.source: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox

item.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

I experienced repeated lag with Call of Duty and the most common answer I found (I am Linksys router as well) was to go into the router settings and change the channel. I haven’t had lag since (except the occasional crap host).

howtogeek.com

How to Find the Best Wi-Fi Channel for Your Router on Any Operating System

If you live in an apartment complex, you’ve probably noticed more than just the passive-aggressive network IDs that your neighbors use—very likely you’ve had problems with your wireless connections dropping out, or just not being as fast as you’d...

Read full topic
item.source: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox

item.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Would it be worth calling the Xbox Customer Support? And I have never had problems with a linksys problems

It’s worth a shot. I’ve always had problems with linksys routers. But, maybe I’m just unlucky.

Read full topic

item.title: A little help with my Internet and my Xbox
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:1, topic:426085”]Ok. I play halo reach and for those of you who play halo, if your internet sucks ass it goes to the black screen every now and then and laggs randomly. The things I have done to fix this is:
Switch to my other Xbox (Didn’t work)
Buy the new Datel Xbox ‘N’ Wireless Networking Adaptor that is rated 4/5 stars (Think its good, don’t think its the cause)
My dad bought a new Linksys E4200 Router (hasent helped yet)
Installed Halo to my hard drive (didn’t work)
Rebooted my internet multiple times (hasen’t worked)

My network status says the Upstrean Bandwitch: Warning!, My NAT is open and my Packet Loss Rate is: Low/Excellent.

I would post on the Bungie forums and Xbox forums but you usually do not get a tech support response so any help?[/quote]

Chances are, if you post on those forums, there’s at least one other user who has posted the same question (it’s very rare that you are the only one to experience a problem)

LInksys routers are also shit.

Read full topic
